channel.title: Shortest Paths :: Data Structures in C#
channel.description: Shortest Paths In this section, we will consider a common graph problem â€” that of finding a shortest path from a node u to a node v in a directed graph. We will assume that each edge contains as its data a nonnegative number. This number may represent a physical distance or some other cost, but for simplicity, we will refer to this value as the length of the edge. We can then define the length of a path to be the sum of the lengths of all the edges along that path.
